comments:
I20071113-0800

- new workspace
- File > Import > Projects from CVS
- paste :pserver:anonymous@dev.eclipse.org:/cvsroot/eclipse
- Next
- enter "org.eclipse.core.expressions"
- Finish
- create package p
- move all *.java files from package org.eclipse.core.expressions to p
- click OK

Tom, can you tell me what this OSGi message means?

Warning
Thu Nov 15 12:06:56 CET 2007
While loading class
"org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.stringsubstitution.SelectedResourceManager",
thread "Thread[main,6,main]" timed out waiting (5000ms) for thread
"Thread[ModalContext,6,main]" to finish starting bundle
"update@plugins/org.eclipse.debug.ui_3.3.100.v20071112.jar [48]". To avoid
deadlock, thread "Thread[main,6,main]" is proceeding but
"org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.stringsubstitution.SelectedResourceManager" may
not be fully initialized.

Markus, are you using a Sun VM?

This indicates that one thread is attempting to load from the org.eclipse.debug.ui bundle while another thread is in the process of activating it.  On the Sun VM a deadlock can occur because the VM locks the classloader way too early.  I'm guessing that you are calling Display.asyncExec() in your bundle activation code.  What can happen in this case is you post a Runnable for SWT to run on the main UI dispatch thread.  Then the dispatch thread wakes up and decides to execute your runnable, this causes the UI thread to attempt to load more classes from your bundle (on the Sun VM the classloader is locked here) but the thread blocks because another thread is currently activating the bundle.  Meanwhile the thread which is activating the bundle continues to run more code which causes more classes to be loaded from your bundle, unfortunately the UI thread has a lock on the bundle classloader (now we are deadlocked).  In Equinox we detect this situation and break out of the deadlock after 5 seconds.  One way to avoid the situation is to put all your async posts at the very end of your activation code so that you exit very quickly without loading additional classes.

> Markus, are you using a Sun VM?

Yes, JDK 1.6.0_02-b06
Fixed in DebugUIPlugin. We had an async to start the "Selected Resource Manager". Moved the async to the last thing in the start method of the debug ui plug-in.
Although I could not reproduce the error the fix seems reasonable, marking as verified.
I agree, looks good in HEAD. I could reproduce consistently before and can no longer reproduce now (with Sun JDK 1.6.0_02-b06).
